maml:description.maml:para: Returns an object with information about the cloud services for the current subscription.

The Get-AzureService cmdlet returns a list object with all of the Azure cloud services associated with the current subscription. If you specify the ServiceName parameter, Get-AzureService returns information on only the matching service.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of a service on which to return information.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the name of a service on which to return information.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Get information about all services --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureService

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns an object that contains information about all of the Azure services associated with the current subscription.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Get information about a specified service --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureService -ServiceName $MySvc

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns information about the $MySvc service.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3: Display available methods and properties --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureService | Get-Member

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command displays the properties and methods that are available from the Get-AzureService cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the cloud service Active Directory (AD) domain extension that applies to all roles or to named roles at a specified deployment slot.
The Get-AzureServiceADDomainExtension cmdlet gets the cloud service AD domain extension that applies to all roles or named roles at a specified deployment slot.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the Azure service name of the deployment.
Specifies the deployment environment. The acceptable values for this parameter are: Production or Staging.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the Azure service name of the deployment.
Specifies the deployment environment. The acceptable values for this parameter are: Production or Staging.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Get the AD domain extension for a specified service --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureServiceADDomainExtension -ServiceName $Svc

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the AD domain extension for the service specified in $Svc.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets configuration details for the Microsoft Antimalware service extension.
The Get-AzureServiceAntimalwareConfig cmdlet gets the antimalware configuration and monitoring configuration details associated with the Microsoft Antimalware extension for a cloud service.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the cloud service.
Specifies a deployment slot. Valid values are:
-- Production
-- Staging
The default value is Production.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the name of the cloud service.
Specifies a deployment slot. Valid values are:
-- Production
-- Staging
The default value is Production.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Get a configuration for a service --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureServiceAntimalwareConfig -ServiceName "ContosoService03"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns the antimalware configuration object for the specified service name. Because this command does not specify the Slot parameter, the command gets the configuration for the default slot, Production. For services that have monitoring enabled, the command also returns a monitoring configuration object.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Get a configuration for a service for the Staging slot --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureServiceAntimalwareConfig -ServiceName "ContosoService03" -Slot Staging

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns the antimalware configuration object for the specified service name. Because this command specifies a value of Staging for the Slot parameter, the command gets the configuration for the Staging slot. For services that have monitoring enabled, the command also returns a monitoring configuration object.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets information about the available extensions for hosted services.
The Get-AzureServiceAvailableExtension cmdlet gets information for the latest available extensions for hosted services.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the extension name.
Specifies the extension provider namespace.
Indicates that this cmdlet gets all versions of an extension.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the extension name.
Specifies the extension provider namespace.
Specifies the extension version.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the extension name.
Specifies the extension provider namespace.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Indicates that this cmdlet gets all versions of an extension.
Specifies the extension version.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Get available extensions --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>Get-AzureServiceAvailableExtension
ProviderNameSpace : Microsoft.Windows.Azure.Extensions ExtensionName : RDP Version : 1.0 Label : Microsoft Azure Remote Desktop Extension Description : Microsoft Azure Remote Desktop Extension HostingResources : WebOrWorkerRole ThumbprintAlgorithm : sha1 PublicConfigurationSchema : <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"><xs:element name="PublicConfig"><xs:complexType><xs:sequence><xs:element name="UserName" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" /><xs:element name="Expiration" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" /></xs:sequence></xs:complexType></xs:element></xs:schema> PrivateConfigurationSchema : <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"><xs:element name="PrivateConfig"><xs:complexType><xs:sequence><xs:element name="Password" type="xs:string" /></xs:sequence></xs:complexType></xs:element></xs:schema> OperationDescription : Get-AzureServiceAvailableExtension OperationId : xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx OperationStatus : Succeeded

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all available extensions.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Get extensions in a specified namespace --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the cloud service diagnostics extension applied on all roles or named roles at a certain deployment slot.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the Azure service name of the deployment.
Specifies the environment of the deployment to modify. The acceptable values for this parameter are: Production or Staging.

Specifies the environment of the deployment to modify. The acceptable values for this parameter are: Production or Staging.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureServiceDiagnosticsExtension -ServiceName $Svc

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command enables a diagnostic service across all roles.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the static VNet IP address information from a virtual machine object, if any.
The Get-AzureStaticVNetIP cmdlet gets the static virtual network (VNet) IP address information from a virtual machine object, if any.

Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the storage accounts for the current Azure subscription.

The Get-AzureStorageAccount cmdlet returns an object containing information about the storage accounts for the current subscription. If the StorageAccountName parameter is specified, then only information about the specified storage account is returned.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of a storage account. If specified, this cmdlet returns only the specified storage account object.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the name of a storage account. If specified, this cmdlet returns only the specified storage account object.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

maml:alert.maml:para: Type help node-dev to get help on Node.js development-related cmdlets. Type help php-dev to get help on PHP development-related cmdlets.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Return all storage accounts --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureStorageAccount

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns an object with all the storage accounts associated with the current subscription.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Return account information for a specified account --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureStorageAccount -StorageAccountName "ContosoStore01"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns an object with only the ContosoStore01 account information.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3: Display a table of storage accounts --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureStorageAccount | Format-Table -AutoSize -Property @{Label="Name";Expression={$_.StorageAccountName}},"Label","Location"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns an object with all the storage accounts associated with the current subscription, and outputs them as a table showing the account name, the account label, and the storage location.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns the primary and secondary storage account keys for an Azure storage account.
The Get-AzureStorageKey cmdlet returns an object with the Azure Storage account name, the primary account key, and the secondary account key of the specified Azure storage account as properties.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the storage account name.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the storage account name.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

maml:alert.maml:para: To get help with Node.js, use the help node-dev command. For help with PHP extensions, use the help php-dev command.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Get an object that contains primary and secondary storage keys --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureStorageKey -StorageAccountName "ContosoStore01"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets an object with the primary and secondary storage keys for the ContosoStore01 storage account.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Get the primary storage account key and store it in a variable --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$ContosoStoreKey = (Get-AzureStorageKey -StorageAccountName "ContosoStore01").Primary

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command puts the primary storage account key for the ContosoStore01 storage account in the $ContosoStoreKey variable.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a list of subnets associated with the specified Azure virtual machine.
The Get-AzureSubnet cmdlet returns a list the subnets associated with the specified virtual machine. Use Get-AzureVM to specify the virtual machine.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the virtual machine object from which to get the subnet list.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the virtual machine object from which to get the subnet list.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Get subnets for a virtual machine --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$VM = Get-AzureVM -ServiceName "ContosoService03" -Name "VirtualMachine01" C:\PS> Get-AzureSubnet -VM $VM

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command gets a virtual machine named VirtualMachine01 in the service named ContosoService03, and then stores it in the $VM variable.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves information from one or more Azure virtual machines.

The Get-AzureVM cmdlet retrieves information about virtual machines running in Azure. It returns an object with information on a specific virtual machine, or if no virtual machine is specified, for all the virtual machines in the specified service of the current subscription.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the cloud service for which to return virtual machine information.

Specifies the name of the virtual machine for which to retrieve information. If this parameter is not provided, the cmdlet returns a list object with information about all the virtual machines in the specified service.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the name of the cloud service for which to return virtual machine information.

Specifies the name of the virtual machine for which to retrieve information. If this parameter is not provided, the cmdlet returns a list object with information about all the virtual machines in the specified service.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Retrieve information on a specified virtual machine --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureVM -ServiceName "ContosoService01" -Name "VirtualMachine02"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns an object with information on the VirtualMachine02 virtual machine running in the ContosoService01 cloud service.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Retrieve information on all virtual machines --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureVM -ServiceName "ContosoService01"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command retrieves a list object with information on all of the virtual machines running in the ContosoService01 cloud service.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3: Display a table of virtual machine statuses --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureVM -ServiceName "ContosoService01" | Format-Table AutoSize -Property "Name",@{Expression={$_.InstanceUpgradeDomain};Label="UpgDom";Align="Right"},"InstanceStatus"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command displays a table showing the virtual machines running on the ContosoService01 service, their Upgrade Domain, and the current status of each machine.

Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Get the setting of the DSC Extension on a virtual machine --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureVMDscExtension -VM $VMModulesUrl https://myaccount.blob.core.contoso.net/windows-powershell-dsc/MyConfiguration.ps1.zipConfigurationFunction : MyConfiguration.ps1\MyConfigurationProperties : {ServerName}ExtensionName : DSCPublisher : Microsoft.PowershellVersion : 1.*PrivateConfiguration :PublicConfiguration : {"ModulesUrl": "https://myaccount.blob.core.contoso.net/windows-powershell-dsc/MyConfiguration.ps1.zip","ConfigurationFunction": "MyConfiguration.ps1\\MyConfiguration","Properties": {"ServerName": "C:\\MyDirectory"}}ReferenceName : DSCState : EnableRoleName : my-vm

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the settings of the DSC Extension on a virtual machine.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the properties on one or a list of operating systems or a virtual machine image in the image repository.

The Get-AzureVMImage cmdlet gets properties on one or a list of operating systems or a virtual machine image in the image repository. The cmdlet returns information for all images in the repository, or about a specific image if its image name is provided.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the operating system or virtual machine image in the image repository. If you do not specify this parameter, all the images are returned.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the name of the operating system or virtual machine image in the image repository. If you do not specify this parameter, all the images are returned.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Get a specific image object from the current image repository. --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureVMImage -ImageName Image001

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the image object named Image001 from the current image repository.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Get all images from the current image repository --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureVMImage

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command retrieves all the images from the current image repository.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3: Set the subscription context and then get all the images --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$SubsId = <MySubscriptionID> C:\PS>$Cert = Get-AzureCertificate cert:\LocalMachine\MY\<CertificateThumbprint> C:\PS>$MyOSImages = Get-AzureVMImage

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets the subscription context and then retrieves all the images from the image repository.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a disk configuration set object from the input image context.
The Get-AzureVMImageDiskConfigSet cmdlet gets a disk configuration set object from the input image context.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the virtual machine image context.
Specifies the virtual machine image context.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Get a disk configuration set object from a virtual machine --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureVMImage -ImageName $Img | Get-AzureVMImageDiskConfigSet

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets a disk configuration set object from a virtual machine.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the Microsoft Antimalware extension details for a virtual machine.

The Get-AzureVMMicrosoftAntimalwareExtension cmdlet gets the Microsoft Antimalware extension details for a virtual machine. This cmdlet gets details for virtual machines that have the extension turned on programmatically by using the Set-AzureVMMicrosoftAntimalwareExtension cmdlet. The cmdlet gets the JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) equivalent for the configuration. If monitoring is turned on, the cmdlet also gets an .xml representation of the antimalware monitoring configuration.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the virtual machine as an IPersistentVM object.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the virtual machine as an IPersistentVM object.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Get information for the extension for a virtual machine --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureVM -ServiceName "ContosoService03" -Name "ContosoVM22" | Get-AzureVMMicrosoftAntimalwareExtension

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets details for the Microsoft Antimalware extension for a virtual machine. The command uses the Get-AzureVM cmdlet to get the specified virtual machine object, and then passes the object to the current cmdlet by using the pipeline operator. Get-AzureVMMicrosoftAntimalwareExtension gets configuration information for the extension.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the Puppet extension applied on a virtual machine.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the Puppet extension applied on a virtual machine.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the settings of the SQL Server IaaS Agent on a particular virtual machine.
The Get-AzureVMSqlServerExtension cmdlet gets the settings of the SQL Server infrastructure as a service (IaaS) Agent on a particular virtual machine.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the persistent virtual machine object that this cmdlet gets settings from.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the persistent virtual machine object that this cmdlet gets settings from.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Get the settings of a SQL Server extension on a virtual machine --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureVMSqlServerExtension-VM $VM ExtensionName : SqlIaaSAgent Publisher : Microsoft.SqlServer.Management Version : 1.0 State : Enable RoleName : VMName AutoPatchingSettings : Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Commands.ServiceManagement.IaaS.Extensions.AutoPatchingSettings AutoBackupSettings : Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Commands.ServiceManagement.IaaS.Extensions.AutoBackupSettings

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the settings of the SQL Server extension on a particular virtual machine.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Get the settings of a SQL Server IaaS Agent on a virtual machine --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureVM -ServiceName "Service" -Name "VMName" | Get-AzureVMSqlServerExtension ExtensionName : SqlIaaSAgent Publisher : Microsoft.SqlServer.Management Version : 1.0 State : Enable RoleName : VMName AutoPatchingSettings : Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Commands.ServiceManagement.IaaS.Extensions.AutoPatchingSettings AutoBackupSettings : Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Commands.ServiceManagement.IaaS.Extensions.AutoBackupSettings

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the settings of the SQL Server IaaS Agent on a particular virtual machine using piped input.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3: Get the settings of specific SQL Server version IaaS Agent on a virtual machine --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureVMSqlServerExtension -VM $VM -Version "1.0" ExtensionName : SqlIaaSAgent Publisher : Microsoft.SqlServer.Management Version : 1.0 State : Enable RoleName : VMName AutoPatchingSettings : Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Commands.ServiceManagement.IaaS.Extensions.AutoPatchingSettings AutoBackupSettings : Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Commands.ServiceManagement.IaaS.Extensions.AutoBackupSettings

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the settings of the particular version of SQL Server IaaS Agent on a virtual machine.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the Azure virtual network configuration from the current subscription.
The Get-AzureVNetConfig cmdlet retrieves the virtual network configuration of the current Azure subscription. If the ExportToFile parameter is specified, a network configuration file is created.

command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureVNetConfig -ExportToFile "c:\temp\MyAzNets.netcfg"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the virtual network configuration of the current Azure subscription and then saves it to a local file.

maml:description.maml:para: Imports an Azure virtual machine state from a file.

The Import-AzureVM cmdlet imports the previously saved state of a virtual machine from an XML file. This cmdlet is useful when you want to subsequently create a virtual machine from the imported data.
Running Export-AzureVM, followed by Remove-AzureVM and then Import-AzureVM to recreate a virtual machine can cause the resultant virtual machine to have a different IP address than the original.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the path of the file with the previously saved virtual machine state.
Specifies the path of the file with the previously saved virtual machine state.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Import a virtual machine state --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Import-AzureVM -Path "C:\VMstate.xml" | New-AzureVM -ServiceName "ContosoService02"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command imports the state of a virtual machine from the VMstate.xml file, and then creates a virtual machine in the specified cloud service.

maml:description.maml:para: Swaps deployments between production and staging.

The Move-AzureDeployment cmdlet swaps the virtual IP addresses of deployments in production and staging environments. This cmdlet swaps a deployment that currently runs in the staging environment to the production environment, and a deployment that runs in the production environment to the staging environment. If there is a deployment in the staging environment and no deployment in the production environment, the cmdlet moves the deployment to production. If there is a deployment in the production environment and no deployment in the staging environment, the cmdlet fails.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the service for which this cmdlet swaps production and staging deployments.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the name of the service for which this cmdlet swaps production and staging deployments.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Swap deployments for a service --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Move-AzureDeployment -ServiceName "ContosoService"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command swaps the deployments of the service named ContosoService between the production and staging environments.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an empty ACL configuration object.
The New-AzureAclConfig cmdlet creates an empty access control list (ACL) configuration object.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Create an ACL configuration object --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Acl = New-AzureAclConfig

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates an empty ACL configuration object, and then stores it in the $Acl variable.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an affinity group in the current subscription.
The New-AzureAffinityGroup cmdlet creates an Azure affinity group in the current Azure subscription.

An affinity group puts your services and their resources together in an Azure datacenter. The affinity group groups members together for optimal performance. Define affinity groups at the subscription level. Your affinity groups are available to any subsequent cloud services or storage accounts that you create. You can add services to an affinity group only when you create it.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies a name for the affinity group. The name must be unique to the subscription.
Specifies a label for the affinity group. The label may be up to 100 characters long.
Specifies a description for the affinity group. The description may be up to 1024 characters long.
Specifies the geographical location of the Azure datacenter where this cmdlet creates the affinity group.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies a name for the affinity group. The name must be unique to the subscription.
Specifies a label for the affinity group. The label may be up to 100 characters long.
Specifies a description for the affinity group. The description may be up to 1024 characters long.
Specifies the geographical location of the Azure datacenter where this cmdlet creates the affinity group.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Create an affinity group --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>New-AzureAffinityGroup -Name "South01" -Location "South Central US" -Label "South Region" -Description "Affinity group for production applications in southern region."

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates an affinity group named South01 in the South Central US region. The command specifies a label and a description.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a certificate setting object for a certificate is in a service.
The New-AzureCertificateSetting cmdlet creates a certificate setting object for a certificate that is in an Azure service.

You can use a certificate setting object to create a configuration object by using the Add-AzureProvisioningConfig cmdlet. Use a configuration object to create virtual machine by using the New-AzureVM cmdlet. You can use a certificate setting object to create a virtual machine by using the New-AzureQuickVM cmdlet.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the certificate store in which to put the certificate. Valid values are:
-- AddressBook
-- AuthRoot
-- CertificateAuthority
-- Disallowed
-- My
-- Root
-- TrustedPeople
-- TrustedPublisher
Specifies the thumbprint of the certificate.
Specifies the certificate store in which to put the certificate. Valid values are:
-- AddressBook
-- AuthRoot
-- CertificateAuthority
-- Disallowed
-- My
-- Root
-- TrustedPeople
-- TrustedPublisher
Specifies the thumbprint of the certificate.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Create a certificate setting object --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>New-AzureCertificateSetting -Thumbprint "D7BECD4D63EBAF86023BB41FA5FBF5C2C924902A" -StoreName "My"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a certificate setting object for an existing certificate.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Create a virtual machine that uses a configuration setting object --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Add-AzureCertificate -ServiceName "ContosoService" -CertToDeploy "C:\temp\ContosoCert.cer" PS C:\> $CertificateSetting = New-AzureCertificateSetting -Thumbprint "D7BECD4D63EBAF86023BB41FA5FBF5C2C924902A" -StoreName "My" PS C:\> $Image = Get-AzureVMImage -ImageName "ContosoStandard" PS C:\> New-AzureVMConfig -Name "VirtualMachine17" -InstanceSize Small -ImageName $Image | Add-AzureProvisioningConfig -Windows -Certificates $CertificateSetting -Password "password" | New-AzureVM -ServiceName "ContosoService"

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command adds the certificate ContosoCert.cer to the service named ContosoService by using the Add-AzureCertificate cmdlet.

The final command creates a virtual machine configuration object based on the image in $Image by using the New-AzureVMConfig cmdlet. The command passes that object to the Add-AzureProvisioningConfig cmdlet by using the pipeline operator. That cmdlet add provisioning information to the configuration. The command passes the object to the New-AzureVM cmdlet, which creates the virtual machine.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a deployment from a service.

The New-AzureDeployment cmdlet creates an Azure deployment from a service that comprises web roles and worker roles. This cmdlet creates a deployment based on a package file (.cspkg) and a service configuration file (.cscfg). Specify a name that is unique within deployment environment.
Use the New-AzureVM cmdlet to create a deployment based on Azure virtual machines.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the Azure service for the deployment.
Specifies the path or URI of a .cspkg file in storage within the same subscription or project.
Specifies the full path of a service configuration file.
Specifies the environment where this cmdlet creates the deployment. Valid values are: Staging and Production. The default value is Production.
Specifies a label name for the deployment. If you do not specify a label, this cmdlet uses a GUID.
Specifies a deployment name. If you do not specify a name, this cmdlet uses a GUID.
Specifies that this cmdlet does not start the deployment.
Specifies that warning messages are errors. If you specify this parameter, a warning message causes the deployment to fail.
Specifies an array of extension configuration objects.
Specifies extended properties.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the name of the Azure service for the deployment.
Specifies the path or URI of a .cspkg file in storage within the same subscription or project.
Specifies the full path of a service configuration file.
Specifies the environment where this cmdlet creates the deployment. Valid values are: Staging and Production. The default value is Production.
Specifies a label name for the deployment. If you do not specify a label, this cmdlet uses a GUID.
Specifies a deployment name. If you do not specify a name, this cmdlet uses a GUID.
Specifies that this cmdlet does not start the deployment.
Specifies that warning messages are errors. If you specify this parameter, a warning message causes the deployment to fail.
Specifies an array of extension configuration objects.
Specifies extended properties.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Create a deployment --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>New-AzureDeployment -ServiceName "ContosoService" -Slot "Production" -Package "https://contosostorage.blob.core.windows.net/container06/ContosoPackage.cspkg" -Configuration "C:\packages\ContosoConfiguration.cscfg" -Label "ContosoDeployment"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a production deployment based on a package named ContosoPackage.cspkg and a configuration named ContosoConfiguration.cscfg. The command specifies a label for the deployment. It does not specify a name. This cmdlet creates a GUID as the name.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Create a deployment based on an extension configuration --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>New-AzureDeployment -ServiceName "ContosoService" -Slot "Production" -Package "https://contosostorage.blob.core.windows.net/container06/ContosoPackage.cspkg" -Configuration "C:\packages\ContosoConfiguration.cscfg" -ExtensionConfiguration "C:\packages\ContosoExtensionConfig.cscfg" -ExtendedProperty @{"key1"="value1"}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a production deployment based on a package and configuration. The command specifies an extension configuration named ContosoExtensionConfig.cscfg. This cmdlet creates GUIDs as the name and the label.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an Azure DNS settings object.
The New-AzureDns cmdlet creates an Azure DNS settings object. You can use a DNS settings object when you create a virtual machine by using the New-AzureVM cmdlet.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies a friendly name for the DNS server. This name is not necessarily a fully qualified domain name.
Specifies the IP address of the DNS server.
Specifies a friendly name for the DNS server. This name is not necessarily a fully qualified domain name.
Specifies the IP address of the DNS server.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Create a DNS settings object --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Dns = New-AzureDns -Name "Dns01" -IPAddress "10.1.2.4"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates an Azure DNS settings object. The DNS server has the specified address and the friendly name Dns01. The command stores the object in the $Dns variable for use by the New-AzureVM cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an internal load balancer configuration.
The New-AzureInternalLoadBalancerConfig cmdlet creates an InternalLoadBalancerConfig object. You can use an internal load balancer configuration when you create an Azure virtual machine deployment.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the internal load balancer that this cmdlet includes in the configuration.
Specifies the name of the subnet for an internal load balancer.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates an internal load balancer configuration for the subnet named FrontEndSubnet. The command stores the configuration in the $IlbConfig variable for you to use for a virtual machine deployment.

maml:description.maml:para: Configures and creates an Azure virtual machine.

The New-AzureQuickVM cmdlet configures and creates an Azure virtual machine. This cmdlet can deploy a virtual machine into an existing Azure service. This cmdlet can alternatively create an Azure service that hosts the new virtual machine.

maml:Description.maml:para: Indicates that this cmdlet creates a Windows virtual machine.
Specifies the name of a new or existing Azure service to which this cmdlet adds the new virtual machine.
If you specify a new service, this cmdlets creates it. To create a new service, you must specify the Location or AffinityGroup parameter.
If you specify an existing service, do not specify Location or AffinityGroup.
Specifies the name of the virtual machine that this cmdlet creates.
Specifies the name of the disk image this cmdlet uses to create the operating system disk.
Specifies the password for the administrative account.
Specifies the fully qualified domain name for reverse DNS look up.

Specifies the Azure datacenter that hosts the virtual machine. If you specify this parameter, the cmdlet creates an Azure service in the specified location. Specify this parameter or the AffinityGroup parameter only if this cmdlet creates an Azure service for the virtual machine.
Specifies the affinity group for the virtual machine. Specify this parameter or the Location parameter only if this cmdlet creates an Azure service for the virtual machine.
Specifies the user name of the Administrator account that this cmdlet creates on the virtual machine.
Specifies a list of certificates that this cmdlet uses to create the service.

Indicates that this cmdlet waits for the virtual machine to reach the state ReadyRole. If the virtual machine reaches one of the following states, the cmdlet fails: FailedStartingVM, ProvisioningFailed, or ProvisioningTimeout.
Indicates that this cmdlet disables Windows Remote Management (WinRM) on HTTPS. By default, WinRM is enabled over HTTPS.
Indicates that this cmdlet enables WinRM over HTTP.
Specifies a certificate that this cmdlet associates to a WinRM endpoint.
Specifies an array of X509 certificates that are deployed to a hosted service.
Indicates that this configuration does not upload the private key.
Indicates that this cmdlet does not add a WinRM endpoint for the virtual machine.
Specifies the name of a virtual network for the virtual machine.
Specifies an array of names of subnet for the virtual machine.
Specifies an array of DNS server objects that defines the DNS settings for the new deployment. To create a DnsServer object, use the New-AzureDns cmdlet.
Specifies the host caching mode for the operating system disk. Valid values are:
-- ReadOnly
-- ReadWrite
Specifies the name of the availability set in which this cmdlet creates the virtual machine.
Specifies the size of the instance. Valid values are:
-- ExtraSmall
-- Small
-- Medium
-- Large
-- ExtraLarge
-- Basic_A0
-- Basic_A1
-- Basic_A2
-- Basic_A3
-- Basic_A4
-- Standard_D1
-- Standard_D2
-- Standard_D3
-- Standard_D4
-- Standard_D11
-- Standard_D12
-- Standard_D13
-- Standard_D14
Specifies the Azure Storage location where this cmdlet creates the virtual machines disks.
Indicates that this cmdlet disables the infrastructure as a service (IaaS) provision guest agent.
Specifies a data file for the virtual machine. This cmdlet encodes the contents of the file as Base64. The file must be less than 64 kilobytes long.
If the guest operating system is the Windows operating system, this cmdlet saves this data as a binary file that is named %SYSTEMDRIVE%\AzureData\CustomData.bin.

If the guest operating system is Linux, this cmdlet passes the data by using the ovf-env.xml file. Installation copies that file to the /var/lib/waagent directory. The agent also stores the Base64 encoded data in /var/lib/waagent/CustomData.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Create a virtual machine --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>New-AzureQuickVM -Windows -ServiceName "ContosoService17" -Name "VirutalMachine01" -ImageName "Image07" -Password "password" -AdminUsername "AdminMain" -WaitForBoot

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a virtual machine that runs the Windows operating system in an existing service. The cmdlet bases the virtual machine on the specified image. The command specifies the WaitForBoot parameter. Therefore, the cmdlet waits for the virtual machine to start.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Create a virtual machine that by using certificates --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$certs = Get-ChildItem Cert:\CurrentUser\My PS C:\> New-AzureQuickVM -Windows -ServiceName "MySvc1" -name "MyWinVM1" -ImageName "Image07" -Password "password" -AdminUserName "AdminMain" -WinRMCertificate $certs[0] -X509Certificates $certs[1], $certs[2] -WaitForBoot

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command gets certificates from a store, and stores them in the $certs variable.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3: Create a virtual machine that runs the Linux operating system --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>New-AzureQuickVM -Linux -ServiceName "ContosoServiceLinux01" -Name "LinuxVirtualMachine01" -ImageName "LinuxImage01" -LinuxUser "RootMain" -Password "password" -Location "Central US"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a virtual machine that runs the Linux operating system from an image. This command creates a service to host the new virtual machine. The command specifies a location for the service.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 4: Create a virtual machine and create a service to host the new virtual machine --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Locations = Get-AzureLocation PS C:\> $Images = Get-AzureVMImage PS C:\> New-AzureQuickVM -Windows -InstanceSize "Large" -ServiceName "ContosoService03" -Name " VirtualMachine25" -ImageName $images[4].imagename -Password "password" -AdminUsername "AdminMain" -Location $Locations[0].name

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command gets locations by using the Get-AzureLocation cmdlet, and then stores them in the $Locations array variable.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 5: Create a virtual machine that has a reserved IP name --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Locations = Get-AzureLocation PS C:\> $Images = Get-AzureVMImage PS C:\> New-AzureQuickVM -Windows -InstanceSize "Large" -ServiceName "ContosoService04" -Name "VirtualMachine27" -ImageName $Images[4].imagename -Password "password" -AdminUsername "AdminMain" -Location $Locations[0].name -ReservedIPName $ipName

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command gets locations, and then stores them in the $Locations array variable.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a reserved IP address.
The New-AzureReservedIP cmdlet creates a reserved IP address.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the reserved IP address name.
Specifies a label for the reserved IP address.
Specifies a location at which to create the reserved IP address.
Specifies a service name.
Specifies that this cmdlet uses the VirtualIPName parameter to reserve an existing virtual IP address (VIP) in your deployment. If this parameter is not specified, this cmdlet reserves a new VIP.
Specifies the deployment slot. The acceptable values for this parameter are: Staging, Production.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the reserved IP address name.
Specifies a label for the reserved IP address.
Specifies a location at which to create the reserved IP address.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies a service name.
Specifies that this cmdlet uses the VirtualIPName parameter to reserve an existing virtual IP address (VIP) in your deployment. If this parameter is not specified, this cmdlet reserves a new VIP.
Specifies the deployment slot. The acceptable values for this parameter are: Staging, Production.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Create a new reserved IP --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>New-AzureReservedIP -ReservedIPName $Name -Label $Label -Location $Location

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a new reserved IP address in the subscription, which can be used for creating cloud services that include Web, Worker, and Virtual Machines.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Create a reserved IP based on an existing IP --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>New-AzureReservedIP -ReservedIPName resip14 -Location "West Europe" -ServiceName piptestwesteurope

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates an existing VIP (Virtual IP) on the specified service.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3: Create a new reserved IP with iptaglist --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>New-AzureReservedIP -ReservedIPName $Name -Label $Label -Location $Location -IPTagList $tag1, $tag2

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a new reserved IP address for a subscription from given tagged ranges

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an Azure service.
The New-AzureService cmdlet creates a new Azure service in the current subscription.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the new service. The name must be unique to the subscription.
Specifies the affinity group associated with the subscription. If you do not specify the Location parameter, an affinity group is required.
Specifies a label for the service. The label may be up to 100 characters in length.
Specifies a description for the service. The description may be up to 1024 characters in length.
Specifies the fully qualified domain name for reverse DNS.
Specifies extended properties.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the name of the new service. The name must be unique to the subscription.
Specifies the location for the service. A location is required if there isn't a specified Affinity Group.
Specifies a label for the service. The label may be up to 100 characters in length.
Specifies a description for the service. The description may be up to 1024 characters in length.
Specifies the fully qualified domain name for reverse DNS.
Specifies extended properties.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the name of the new service. The name must be unique to the subscription.
Specifies the affinity group associated with the subscription. If you do not specify the Location parameter, an affinity group is required.
Specifies a label for the service. The label may be up to 100 characters in length.
Specifies a description for the service. The description may be up to 1024 characters in length.
Specifies the fully qualified domain name for reverse DNS.
Specifies extended properties.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the location for the service. A location is required if there isn't a specified Affinity Group.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Create a service --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>New-AzureService -ServiceName "MySvc01" -Label "MyTestService" -Location "South Central US" -ExtendedProperty @{"key1"="value1"}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a new service named MySvc01 in the South Central US location.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Create a service in an affinity group --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>New-AzureService -ServiceName "MySvc01" -AffinityGroup NorthRegion -ExtendedProperty @{"key1"="value1"}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a new service named MySvc01 using the NorthRegion affinity group.

maml:description.maml:para: Generates the configuration for the AD domain extension for cloud services.
The New-AzureServiceADDomainExtensionConfig cmdlet generates the configuration for the Active Directory (AD) domain extension for cloud services.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies an optional array of roles to specify the remote desktop configuration for the AD domain configuration. If you do not specify this parameter, the AD domain configuration is applied as the default configuration for all roles.
Specifies an X.509 certificate that is automatically uploaded to the cloud service and used for encrypting the extension private configuration.
Specifies a thumbprint hashing algorithm that is used with the thumbprint to identify the certificate. This parameter is optional and the default is sha1.
Specifies the AD domain name.
Specifies whether to restart the computer if the join operation succeeds.
Specifies the credentials to use to join the AD domain. Credentials include a user name and password.
Specifies the credentials (user name and password) to unjoin the AD domain.
Specifies the unsigned integer join option.
Specifies the organization unit (OU) path for AD domain join operation.
Specifies the extension version.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Create the Azure Diagnostics extension for all roles in the cloud service --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$WadConfig = New-AzureServiceDiagnosticExtensionConfig -StorageContext $StorageContext -DiagnosticsConfigurationPath $WadConfigXML

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates the Azure Diagnostics extension for all of the roles in the cloud service.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Create the Azure Diagnostics extension for a role --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$WadConfig = New-AzureServiceDiagnosticExtensionConfig -StorageContext $StorageContext -DiagnosticsConfigurationPath $WadConfigXML -Role "WebRole1"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates the Azure Diagnostics extension for the role WebRole01 in the cloud service.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Create an extension configuration --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>New-AzureServiceExtensionConfig -ExtensionName 'RDP' -Version '1.0' -ProviderNamespace Microsoft.Windows.Azure.Extensions -PublicConfiguration $p1 -PrivateConfiguration $p2;

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command specifies an extension configuration.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a SSH Key object to insert an existing certificate into a new Linux-based Azure virtual machines.

The New-AzureSSHKey cmdlet creates an SSH Key object for a certificate that has already been added to Azure. This SSH Key object can then be used by New-AzureProvisioningConfig when creating the configuration object for a new virtual machine using New-AzureVM, or when creating a new virtual machine with New-AzureQuickVM. When included as part of a virtual machine creation script, this adds the specified SSH Public Key or Key Pair to the new virtual machine.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies that this cmdlet creates an object for inserting an SSH Key Pair into the new virtual machine configuration.
Specifies the fingerprint of the certificate.
Specifies the path to store the SSH Public Key or Key Pair.
Specifies that this cmdlet creates an object for inserting an SSH Public Key into the new virtual machine configuration.
Specifies the fingerprint of the certificate.
Specifies the path to store the SSH Public Key or Key Pair.
Specifies that this cmdlet creates an object for inserting an SSH Key Pair into the new virtual machine configuration.
Specifies the fingerprint of the certificate.
Specifies the path to store the SSH Public Key or Key Pair.
Specifies that this cmdlet creates an object for inserting an SSH Public Key into the new virtual machine configuration.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Create a certificate setting object --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$myLxCert = New-AzureSSHKey -Fingerprint $fingerprint -Path "/home/username/.ssh/authorized_keys"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a certificate setting object for an existing certificate and then stores the object in a variable for later use.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Add a certificate to a service --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Add-AzureCertificate -ServiceName "MySvc" -CertToDeploy "C:\temp\MyLxCert.cer" $myLxCert = New-AzureSSHKey ?Fingerprint $fingerprint -Path "/home/username/.ssh/authorized_keys" New-AzureVMConfig -Name "MyVM2" -InstanceSize Small -ImageName $LxImage ` | Add-AzureProvisioningConfig -Linux -LinuxUser $lxUser -SSHPublicKeys $myLxCert -Password 'password' ` | New-AzureVM -ServiceName "MySvc"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds a certificate to an Azure service, and then creates a new Linux virtual machine that uses the certificate.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new storage account in an Azure subscription.

The New-AzureStorageAccount cmdlet creates an account that provides access to Azure storage services. A storage account is a globally unique resource within the storage system. The account is the parent namespace for the Blob, Queue, and Table services.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies a name for the storage account. The storage account name must be unique to Azure and must be between 3 and 24 characters in length and use lowercase letters and numbers only.
Specifies a label for the storage account. The label may be up to 100 characters in length.
Specifies a description for the storage account. The description may be up to 1024 characters in length.
Specifies the name of an existing affinity group in the current subscription. You can specify either the Location or AffinityGroup parameter, but not both.
Specifies the type of the storage account. Valid values are:
-- Standard_LRS
-- Standard_ZRS
-- Standard_GRS
-- Standard_RAGRS
-- Premium_LRS
If this parameter is not specified, the default value is Standard_GRS.
Standard_ZRS or Premium_LRS accounts cannot be changed to other account types, and vice versa.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies a name for the storage account. The storage account name must be unique to Azure and must be between 3 and 24 characters in length and use lowercase letters and numbers only.
Specifies a label for the storage account. The label may be up to 100 characters in length.
Specifies a description for the storage account. The description may be up to 1024 characters in length.
Specifies the type of the storage account. Valid values are:
-- Standard_LRS
-- Standard_ZRS
-- Standard_GRS
-- Standard_RAGRS
-- Premium_LRS
If this parameter is not specified, the default value is Standard_GRS.
Standard_ZRS or Premium_LRS accounts cannot be changed to other account types, and vice versa.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the Azure data center location where the storage account is created. You can include either the Location or AffinityGroup parameter, but not both.
Specifies a name for the storage account. The storage account name must be unique to Azure and must be between 3 and 24 characters in length and use lowercase letters and numbers only.
Specifies a label for the storage account. The label may be up to 100 characters in length.
Specifies a description for the storage account. The description may be up to 1024 characters in length.
Specifies the name of an existing affinity group in the current subscription. You can specify either the Location or AffinityGroup parameter, but not both.
Specifies the type of the storage account. Valid values are:
-- Standard_LRS
-- Standard_ZRS
-- Standard_GRS
-- Standard_RAGRS
-- Premium_LRS
If this parameter is not specified, the default value is Standard_GRS.
Standard_ZRS or Premium_LRS accounts cannot be changed to other account types, and vice versa.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the Azure data center location where the storage account is created. You can include either the Location or AffinityGroup parameter, but not both.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Create a storage account for a specified affinity group --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>New-AzureStorageAccount -StorageAccountName "azure01" -Label "AzureOne" -AffinityGroup "prodapps"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a storage account for a specified affinity group.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Create a storage account in a specified location --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>New-AzureStorageAccount -StorageAccountName "azure02" -Label "AzureTwo" -Location "North Central US"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a storage account in a specified location.

maml:description.maml:para: Regenerates storage keys for an Azure storage account.

The New-AzureStorageKey cmdlet regenerates the primary or secondary key for an Azure Storage account. It returns an object that contains the storage account name, primary key, and secondary key as properties.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies which key to regenerate. Valid values are: Primary and Secondary.
Specifies the name of the Azure Storage account for which to regenerate a key.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies which key to regenerate. Valid values are: Primary and Secondary.
Specifies the name of the Azure Storage account for which to regenerate a key.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Regenerate a primary storage key --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>New-AzureStorageKey -KeyType "Primary" -StorageAccountName "ContosoStore01"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command regenerates the primary storage key for the ContosoStore01 storage account.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Regenerate a secondary storage key and save it in a variable --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$ContosoStoreKey = New-AzureStorageKey -KeyType "Secondary" -StorageAccountName "ContosoStore01"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command regenerate the secondary storage key for the ContosoStore01 storage account and stores the updated storage account key information in the $ContosoStoreKey.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an Azure virtual machine.

The New-AzureVM cmdlet adds a new virtual machine to an existing Azure service, or creates a virtual machine and service in the current subscription if either the Location or AffinityGroup is specified.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the new or existing service name.
If the service does not exist, this cmdlet creates it for you. Use the Location or AffinityGroup parameter to specify where to create the service.
If the service exists, the Location or AffinityGroup parameter is not needed.
Specifies a label for the deployment.
Specifies a deployment name. If not specified, this cmdlet uses the service name as the deployment name.
Specifies the virtual network name where this cmdlet deploys the virtual machine.
Specifies a DNS Server object that defines the DNS settings for the new deployment.
Specifies an internal load balancer. This parameter is not used.
Specifies a list of virtual machine objects to create.

Specifies that this cmdlet waits for the virtual machine to reach the ReadyRole state. This cmdlet fails if the virtual machine falls in one of the following states while waiting: FailedStartingVM, ProvisioningFailed, ProvisioningTimeout.
Specifies the name of the reserved IP address.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the location that hosts the new service. If the service already exists, do not specify this parameter.
Specifies the Azure affinity group in which the cloud service resides. This parameter is required only when this cmdlet creates a cloud service.
Specifies a label for the new service.
Specifies the fully-qualified domain name for reverse DNS.
Specifies a description for the new service.
Specifies the new or existing service name.
If the service does not exist, this cmdlet creates it for you. Use the Location or AffinityGroup parameter to specify where to create the service.
If the service exists, the Location or AffinityGroup parameter is not needed.
Specifies a label for the deployment.
Specifies a deployment name. If not specified, this cmdlet uses the service name as the deployment name.
Specifies the virtual network name where this cmdlet deploys the virtual machine.
Specifies a DNS Server object that defines the DNS settings for the new deployment.
Specifies an internal load balancer. This parameter is not used.
Specifies a list of virtual machine objects to create.

Specifies that this cmdlet waits for the virtual machine to reach the ReadyRole state. This cmdlet fails if the virtual machine falls in one of the following states while waiting: FailedStartingVM, ProvisioningFailed, ProvisioningTimeout.
Specifies the name of the reserved IP address.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the location that hosts the new service. If the service already exists, do not specify this parameter.
Specifies the Azure affinity group in which the cloud service resides. This parameter is required only when this cmdlet creates a cloud service.
Specifies a label for the new service.
Specifies the fully-qualified domain name for reverse DNS.
Specifies a description for the new service.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Create a virtual machine for a Windows configuration --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>New-AzureVMConfig -Name "VirtualMachine07" -InstanceSize ExtraSmall -ImageName (Get-AzureVMImage)[4].ImageName | Add-AzureProvisioningConfig -Windows -Password $adminPassword -AdminUsername PsTestAdmin | New-AzureVM -ServiceName "ContosoService" -AffinityGroup "Contoso" -WaitForBoot

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a provisioning configuration based on a virtual machine configuration for the Windows operating system, and uses it to create a virtual machine in a specified affinity group.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Create a virtual machine for a Linux configuration --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>New-AzureVMConfig -Name "SUSEVM02" -InstanceSize ExtraSmall -ImageName (Get-AzureVMImage)[7].ImageName | Add-AzureProvisioningConfig -Linux -LinuxUser "RootMain" -Password "password" -AdminUsername PsTestAdmin | New-AzureVM

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a provisioning configuration based on a virtual machine configuration for Linux, and uses it to create a virtual machine in a specified affinity group.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3: Create a virtual machine and add a data disk --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Images = Get-AzureVMImage PS C:\> $Image = $Images[4] PS C:\> $VirtualMachine02 = New-AzureVMConfig -Name "VirtualMachine02" -InstanceSize ExtraSmall -ImageName $myImage.ImageName | Add-AzureProvisioningConfig -Windows -Password "password" | Add-AzureDataDisk -CreateNew -DiskSizeInGB 50 -DiskLabel "DataDisk50" -LUN 0

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first two commands get available images by using the Get-AzureVMImage cmdlet, and stores one of them in the $Image variable.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 4: Create a virtual machine with a reserved IP address --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>New-AzureVMConfig -Name "VirtualMachine06" -InstanceSize ExtraSmall -ImageName (Get-AzureVMImage)[4].ImageName | Add-AzureProvisioningConfig -Windows -Password $adminPassword -AdminUsername "AdminMain" | New-AzureVM -ServiceName "ContosoService02" -AffinityGroup "Contoso" -ReservedIPName $ipName

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a provisioning configuration based on a virtual machine configuration for the Windows operating system, and uses it to create a virtual machine with a reserved IP address.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an Azure virtual machine configuration object.
The New-AzureVMConfig cmdlet creates an Azure virtual machine configuration object. You can use this object to perform a new deployment and add a new virtual machine to an existing deployment.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the virtual machine.
Specifies the size of the instance.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:

-- Small
-- Medium
-- Large
-- ExtraLarge

-- Basic_A4

-- ReadWrite
Specifies the name of the availability set.
Specifies a label to assign to the virtual machine.
Specifies the name of the virtual machine image to use for the operating system disk.
Specifies the Azure storage location for the new virtual machine disk.
Specifies a label for the operating system disk.
Boot diagnostics is enabled by default on the Virtual Machine. This allows the user to disable that behavior.
Specifies that the image or disk that is being used was licensed on-premises. This element is only used for images that contain the Windows Server operating system.
Possible values are: - Windows_Client
- Windows_Server
