maml:description.maml:para: Configures the Microsoft Antimalware extension for a virtual machine.
The Set-AzureVMMicrosoftAntimalwareExtension cmdlet configures the Microsoft Antimalware extension for a virtual machine. You can enable, disable, or uninstall the extension.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the absolute path of the Microsoft Antimalware configuration file. Do not specify this parameter if you specify the AntimalwareConfiguration parameter. The configuration file must include, at a minimum, the following content to enable the Microsoft Antimalware extension:
{ "AntimalwareEnabled": true }
Specifies the extension version as a string.
Specifies whether to collect Microsoft Antimalware events.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- ON. Collect Microsoft Antimalware events to storage context.
-- OFF. Do not collect Microsoft Antimalware events.
Specifies an Azure storage context for Microsoft Antimalware monitoring.
Specifies the virtual machine as an IPersistentVM object.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

Specifies a string object that contains the Microsoft Antimalware configuration. This object must not be $Null or empty. Do not specify this parameter if you specify the AntimalwareConfigFile parameter. The configuration object must include, at a minimum, the following content to enable the Microsoft Antimalware extension: { "AntimalwareEnabled": true }
Microsoft Antimalware JSON configuration sample:
{ "AntimalwareEnabled": true, "RealtimeProtectionEnabled": true, "ScheduledScanSettings": { "isEnabled": true, "day": 1, "time": 120, "scanType": "Full" },
"Exclusions": { "Extensions": ".ext1;.ext2", "Paths": "c:\excluded-path-1;c:\excluded-path-2", "Processes": "excludedproc1.exe;excludedproc2.exe" }
Notes: AntimalwareEnabled is a required parameter. Values: true= Enable. false= Error out as false is not a supported value
RealtimeProtectionEnabled: true/false. true = Enable. false = Disable. Default is true

ScheduledScanSettings: isEnabled=true/false day=0-8 (0-daily, 1-Sunday, 2-Monday, ...., 7-Saturday, 8-Disabled) time=0-1440 (measured in minutes after midnight - 60->1AM, 120 -> 2AM, ... ) scanType="Quick" or "Full" (Default is Quick) Note: If isEnabled=true is the only setting provided, the following defaults are set: day=7 (Saturday), time=120 (2 AM), scanType="Quick" Exclusions: Multiple exclusions in the same list are specified by using semicolon delimiters.
If no exclusions are specified, then the existing exclusions, if any, are overwritten by blank on the system.
Specifies the extension version as a string.
Specifies whether to collect Microsoft Antimalware events.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- ON. Collect Microsoft Antimalware events to storage context.
-- OFF. Do not collect Microsoft Antimalware events.
Specifies an Azure storage context for Microsoft Antimalware monitoring.
Specifies the virtual machine as an IPersistentVM object.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the extension version as a string.

Indicates that the cmdlet disables the Microsoft Antimalware extension. To re-enable the extension on the same virtual machine, run Set-AzureVMMicrosoftAntimalwareExtension without the Disable parameter.
Specifies the virtual machine as an IPersistentVM object.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies whether to collect Microsoft Antimalware events.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- ON. Collect Microsoft Antimalware events to storage context.
-- OFF. Do not collect Microsoft Antimalware events.
Specifies an Azure storage context for Microsoft Antimalware monitoring.
Specifies the virtual machine as an IPersistentVM object.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

Indicates that this cmdlet uninstalls the Microsoft Antimalware extension from the virtual machine. If monitoring was turned on, the cmdlet also removes the collection of Microsoft Antimalware events.
Specifies the virtual machine as an IPersistentVM object.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

Specifies the absolute path of the Microsoft Antimalware configuration file. Do not specify this parameter if you specify the AntimalwareConfiguration parameter. The configuration file must include, at a minimum, the following content to enable the Microsoft Antimalware extension:
{ "AntimalwareEnabled": true }
Specifies the extension version as a string.
Specifies whether to collect Microsoft Antimalware events.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- ON. Collect Microsoft Antimalware events to storage context.
-- OFF. Do not collect Microsoft Antimalware events.
Specifies an Azure storage context for Microsoft Antimalware monitoring.
Specifies the virtual machine as an IPersistentVM object.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

Specifies a string object that contains the Microsoft Antimalware configuration. This object must not be $Null or empty. Do not specify this parameter if you specify the AntimalwareConfigFile parameter. The configuration object must include, at a minimum, the following content to enable the Microsoft Antimalware extension: { "AntimalwareEnabled": true }
Microsoft Antimalware JSON configuration sample:
{ "AntimalwareEnabled": true, "RealtimeProtectionEnabled": true, "ScheduledScanSettings": { "isEnabled": true, "day": 1, "time": 120, "scanType": "Full" },
"Exclusions": { "Extensions": ".ext1;.ext2", "Paths": "c:\excluded-path-1;c:\excluded-path-2", "Processes": "excludedproc1.exe;excludedproc2.exe" }
Notes: AntimalwareEnabled is a required parameter. Values: true= Enable. false= Error out as false is not a supported value
RealtimeProtectionEnabled: true/false. true = Enable. false = Disable. Default is true

ScheduledScanSettings: isEnabled=true/false day=0-8 (0-daily, 1-Sunday, 2-Monday, ...., 7-Saturday, 8-Disabled) time=0-1440 (measured in minutes after midnight - 60->1AM, 120 -> 2AM, ... ) scanType="Quick" or "Full" (Default is Quick) Note: If isEnabled=true is the only setting provided, the following defaults are set: day=7 (Saturday), time=120 (2 AM), scanType="Quick" Exclusions: Multiple exclusions in the same list are specified by using semicolon delimiters.
If no exclusions are specified, then the existing exclusions, if any, are overwritten by blank on the system.

Indicates that the cmdlet disables the Microsoft Antimalware extension. To re-enable the extension on the same virtual machine, run Set-AzureVMMicrosoftAntimalwareExtension without the Disable parameter.

Indicates that this cmdlet uninstalls the Microsoft Antimalware extension from the virtual machine. If monitoring was turned on, the cmdlet also removes the collection of Microsoft Antimalware events.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Enable the extension by using a configuration file --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureVM -ServiceName "ContosoService03" -Name "ContosoVM22" | Set-AzureVMMicrosoftAntimalwareExtension -AntimalwareConfigFile 'C:\configuration\contosoVM.json' | Update-AzureVM

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command enables the Microsoft Antimalware extension by using a configuration file. The command uses the Get-AzureVM cmdlet to get the specified virtual machine object, and then passes the object to the current cmdlet by using the pipeline operator.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Enable the extension and enable monitoring --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$StorageContext = New-AzureStorageContext -StorageAccountName "contosostoragemain" -StorageAccountKey (Get-AzureStorageKey -StorageAccountName "Contosostoragemain").PrimaryP S C:\> Get-AzureVM -ServiceName "ContosoService03" -Name"ContosoVM22" | Set-AzureVMMicrosoftAntimalwareExtension -AntimalwareConfigFile 'C:\configuration\contosoVM.json" -Monitoring ON -StorageContext $StorageContext | Update-AzureVM

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates an AzureStorageContext object by using the New-AzureStorageContext cmdlet, and then stores it in the $StorageContext variable.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3: Enable the extension by specifying a configuration object --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Config_String = [IO.File]::ReadAllText('C:\configuration\contosoVM.json') PS C:\> Get-AzureVM -ServiceName "ContosoService03" -Name "ContosoVM22" | Set-AzureVMMicrosoftAntimalwareExtension -AntimalwareConfiguration $Config_String | Update-AzureVM

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a string object by reading a JSON configuration for the Microsoft Antimalware extension, and then storing it in the $config_string variable.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 4: Disable the extension --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureVM -ServiceName "ContosoService03" -Name "ContosoVM22" | Set-AzureVMMicrosoftAntimalwareExtension -Disable | Update-AzureVM

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command disables the extension without removing it. The command uses Get-AzureVM to get the specified virtual machine object, and then passes the object to the current cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 5: Remove the extension --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureVM -ServiceName "ContosoService03" -Name"ContosoVM22" | Set-AzureVMMicrosoftAntimalwareExtension -Uninstall | Update-AzureVM

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the Microsoft Antimalware extension from the virtual machine. The command uses Get-AzureVM to get the specified virtual machine object, and then passes the object to the current cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the Puppet extension for a virtual machine.
The Set-AzureVMPuppetExtension cmdlet sets the Puppet extension for a virtual machine.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of puppet master server.
Specifies the extension version.
Indicates that this cmdlet disables the extension state.
Specifies the reference name of the extension.

This is a user-defined string that is used to refer to an extension. It is specified when the extension is added to the virtual machine for the first time. For subsequent updates, you need to specify the previously used reference name when you update the extension. The ReferenceName assigned to an extension is returned using the Get-AzureVM cmdlet.
Specifies the persistent virtual machine object.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of puppet master server.
Specifies the extension version.
Indicates that this cmdlet disables the extension state.
Specifies the reference name of the extension.

This is a user-defined string that is used to refer to an extension. It is specified when the extension is added to the virtual machine for the first time. For subsequent updates, you need to specify the previously used reference name when you update the extension. The ReferenceName assigned to an extension is returned using the Get-AzureVM cmdlet.
Specifies the persistent virtual machine object.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Set the Puppet extension for a virtual machine --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Set-AzureVMPuppetExtension -VM $VM

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example sets the Puppet extension for the specified virtual machine as stored in the variable $VM.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the size of an Azure virtual machine.

The Set-AzureVMSize cmdlet updates the size of a virtual machine. It has two parameters: InstanceSize, which is the new size of the virtual machine, and VM, which is a virtual machine object retrieved by using the Get-AzureVM cmdlet. The result of Set-AzureVMSize can be piped to the Update-AzureVM cmdlet or stored in a variable for later use. No actual change is made until Update-AzureVM is executed.
Note: This cmdlet will require the virtual machine to be re-provisioned and it might get a new IP address.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the size of the machine.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
--ExtraSmall
--Small
--Medium
--Large
--ExtraLarge
Specifies the persistent virtual machine object that this cmdlet sets the size of.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the size of the machine.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
--ExtraSmall
--Small
--Medium
--Large
--ExtraLarge
Specifies the persistent virtual machine object that this cmdlet sets the size of.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Set the size of a virtual machine --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureVM -ServiceName "MySvc1" -Name "MyVM3" | Set-AzureVMSize "Small" | Update-AzureVM

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command updates a virtual machine to size "Small".

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the Azure SQL Server extension on a virtual machine.
The Set-AzureVMSqlServerExtension cmdlet sets the Azure SQL Server extension on a virtual machine.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the reference name of the SQL Server extension.
Specifies the version of the SQL Server extension that Get-AzureVMSqlServerExtension retrieves settings from.
Specifies the automatic SQL Server patching settings.
Specifies the automatic SQL Server backup settings.
Specifies the persistent virtual machine object.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the reference name of the SQL Server extension.
Specifies the version of the SQL Server extension that Get-AzureVMSqlServerExtension retrieves settings from.
Indicates that this cmdlet disables the extension state.
Specifies the persistent virtual machine object.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the reference name of the SQL Server extension.
Specifies the version of the SQL Server extension that Get-AzureVMSqlServerExtension retrieves settings from.
Indicates that this cmdlet uninstalls the SQL Server extension from the virtual machine.
Specifies the persistent virtual machine object.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the reference name of the SQL Server extension.
Specifies the version of the SQL Server extension that Get-AzureVMSqlServerExtension retrieves settings from.
Specifies the automatic SQL Server patching settings.
Specifies the automatic SQL Server backup settings.
Specifies the persistent virtual machine object.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Indicates that this cmdlet disables the extension state.
Indicates that this cmdlet uninstalls the SQL Server extension from the virtual machine.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Set autopatching settings on a virtual machine --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureVM -ServiceName "ServiceName" -Name "VMName" | Set-AzureVMSqlServerExtension -AutoPatchingSettings $APS | Update-AzureVM

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets auto-patching settings on an Azure virtual machine.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Set autobackup settings on a virtual machine --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureVM -ServiceName "ServiceName" -Name "VMName" | Set-AzureVMSqlServerExtension -AutoBackupSettings $ABS | Update-AzureVM

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets auto-backup settings on Azure virtual machine.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3: Disable an SQL Server extension on a virtual machine --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureVM -ServiceName "Service" -Name "VMName" | Set-AzureVMSqlServerExtension -Disable

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command disables SQL Server virtual machine extension on a given virtual machine.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 4: Uninstall an SQL Server extension on a specific virtual machine --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureVM -ServiceName "Service" -Name "VMName" | Set-AzureVMSqlServerExtension -Uninstall

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command uninstalls a SQL Server virtual machine extension on the virtual machine named VMName.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates the virtual network settings for an Azure cloud service.

The Set-AzureVNetConfig cmdlet updates the network configuration for the current Azure subscription by specifying a path to anetwork configuration file (.netcfg). The network configuration file defines DNS servers and subnets for cloud services within a subscription.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the path and file name of a network configuration file (.netcfg).
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the path and file name of a network configuration file (.netcfg).
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Update the network configuration of the Azure subscription to a local file --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Set-AzureVNetConfig -ConfigurationPath "c:\temp\MyAzNets.netcfg"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command updates the network configuration of the current Microsoft Azure subscription to that in the local file "c:\temp\MyAzNets.netcfg".

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Set the Azure subscription and then update the network configuration --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$SubsId = "5bea2bc2-88a5-44b8-abe1-3e76733b6783" C:\PS> $Cert = Get-Item cert:\LocalMachine\MY\82F105B2DA81149204A6257A9A91EC452B8C52C3 C:\PS> Set-AzureVNetConfig -ConfigurationPath "c:\temp\MyAzNets.netcfg"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example sets the Microsoft Azure subscription, and then updates the network configuration of that subscription using the configuration defined in the local file "c:\temp\MyAzNets.netcfg".

maml:description.maml:para: Walks the specified upgrade domain.

The Set-AzureWalkUpgradeDomain cmdlet initiates the actual upgrade of an Azure deployment. The upgrade package and configuration are set by using the Set-AzureDeployment cmdlet with the -Upgrade switch.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the Microsoft Azure service name to upgrade.
Specifies the environment of the deployment to upgrade.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Staging
-- Production
Specifies the upgrade domain to upgrade.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the Microsoft Azure service name to upgrade.
Specifies the environment of the deployment to upgrade.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Staging
-- Production
Specifies the upgrade domain to upgrade.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Initiate an upgrade of a production deployment --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Set-AzureWalkUpgradeDomain -ServiceName "MySvc1" -slot "Production" -UpgradeDomain 2

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command initiates the upgrade of Upgrade Domain 2 of the production deployment of the MySvc1 service.

maml:description.maml:para: Starts an Azure virtual machine.
The Start-AzureVM cmdlet requests the start of an Azure virtual machine.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the Azure service that contains the virtual machine to start.
Specifies the name of the virtual machine to start.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the name of the Azure service that contains the virtual machine to start.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies a virtual machine object that identifies the virtual machine to start.
Specifies the name of the virtual machine to start.
Specifies the name of the Azure service that contains the virtual machine to start.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies a virtual machine object that identifies the virtual machine to start.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Start a virtual machine --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Start-AzureVM -ServiceName "ContosoService03" -Name "VirtualMachine04"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command starts the virtual machine named VirtualMachine04 that runs in the Azure service named ContosoService03.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Start a virtual machine by using a virtual machine object --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureVM -ServiceName "ContosoService03" -Name "DatabaseServer" | Start-AzureVM

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command retrieves the virtual machine object for the virtual machine whose name is DatabaseServer, and then requests to start it.

maml:description.maml:para: Shuts down an Azure virtual machine.
The Stop-AzureVM cmdlet shuts down a virtual machine.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the Azure service that contains the virtual machine to shut down.
Specifies the name of the virtual machine to shut down.

Use the wildcard character to stop multiple virtual machines asynchronously. With a wildcard character, this cmdlet calls the Shutdown Roles operation (http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn469421.aspx), instead of the Shutdown Role operation (http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/jj157195.aspx).
Specifies that this cmdlet keeps the virtual machine provisioned.
Specifies whether to allow the deallocation of the last virtual machine in a deployment.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the name of the Azure service that contains the virtual machine to shut down.
Specifies that this cmdlet keeps the virtual machine provisioned.
Specifies whether to allow the deallocation of the last virtual machine in a deployment.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies a virtual machine object that identifies the virtual machine to shut down.
Specifies the name of the virtual machine to shut down.

Use the wildcard character to stop multiple virtual machines asynchronously. With a wildcard character, this cmdlet calls the Shutdown Roles operation (http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn469421.aspx), instead of the Shutdown Role operation (http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/jj157195.aspx).
Specifies that this cmdlet keeps the virtual machine provisioned.
Specifies whether to allow the deallocation of the last virtual machine in a deployment.
Specifies the name of the Azure service that contains the virtual machine to shut down.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies a virtual machine object that identifies the virtual machine to shut down.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Shut down a virtual machine --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Stop-AzureVM -ServiceName "ContosoService01" -Name "MyVM"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command shuts down a virtual machine that the specified service contains.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Shut down a virtual machine by using a virtual machine object --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureVM -ServiceName "ContosoService01" -Name "MyVM" | Stop-AzureVM

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command shuts down a virtual machine that the specified service contains, by using the virtual machine object that Get-AzureVM returns.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3: Shut down a VM and keep the VM provisioned --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Stop-AzureVM -ServiceName "ContosoService01" -Name "MyVM" -StayProvisioned

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command shuts down a virtual machine that the specified service contains, and keeps it provisioned.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 4: Shut down a VM and allow deallocation of the last VM in the deployment --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Stop-AzureVM -ServiceName "ContosoService01" -Name "MyVM" -Force

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command shuts down a virtual machine that the specified service contains and allows deallocation of the last virtual machine in the deployment.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 5: Shut down multiple VMs --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Stop-AzureVM -ServiceName "PSTestService" -Name "*" -Force

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command shuts down multiple virtual machines that the specified service contains.

maml:description.maml:para: Changes the label of a disk in the Azure disk repository.
The Update-AzureDisk cmdlet changes the label that is associated with a disk in the disk repository of the current Azure subscription.

command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Update-AzureDisk ?DiskName "ContosoOSDisk" -Label "DoNotUse"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command changes the label of the disk named ContosoOSDisk to DoNotUse.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies the configuration of an Azure virtual machine.

The Update-AzureVM cmdlet accepts update information for the specified virtual machine and initiates the update. You can add or remove data disks, modify the cache mode of data or operating system disks, change the network endpoints, or change the size of the virtual machine.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the Azure service.
Specifies the name of the virtual machine to update.
Specifies the virtual machine object that includes updated settings.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the name of the virtual machine to update.
Specifies the virtual machine object that includes updated settings.
Specifies the name of the Azure service.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Update the size of a virtual machine --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureVM -ServiceName "ContosoService03" -Name "VirtualMachine04" | Set-AzureVMSize -InstanceSize "Medium" | Update-AzureVM

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command changes the size of the virtual machine named VirtualMachine04, running in the service named ContosoService03, to Medium.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Add a data disk to a virtual machine --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureVM -ServiceName "ContosoService03" -Name "VirtualMachine05" | Add-AzureDataDisk -CreateNew -MediaLocation "https://ContosoStore1.blob.core.azure.com/vhds/Disk22.vhd" -DiskSizeInGB 128 -DiskLabel "Data-128" -LUN 0 | Update-AzureVM

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds a new data disk to the virtual machine named VirtualMachine05, running in the service named ContosoService03.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates the label of an operating system image in the image repository.
The Update-AzureVMImage cmdlet updates the label on an operating system image in the image repository. It returns an image object with information about the updated image.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the image to update in the image repository.
Specifies the new label of the image.
Specifies the standard icon name for the operating system or virtual machine image.
Specifies the small icon name for the operating system or virtual machine image.
Specifies the End User License Agreement. We recommend that the value is a URL.
Specifies the description of the operating system image.
Specifies a value that can be used to group operating system or virtual machine images.
Specifies the date when the operating system image was added to the image repository.
Specifies the URI that points to a document that contains the privacy policy related to the operating system image.
Specifies the size of the virtual machine.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Medium
-- Large
-- ExtraLarge

Specifies the operating system disk and data disk configuration for the virtual machine image created by using the New-AzureVMImageDiskConfigSet, Set-AzureVMImageOSDiskConfig, and Set-AzureVMImageDataDiskConfig cmdlets.
Specifies the language for the operating system in the virtual machine or operating system image.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.
Specifies the name of the image to update in the image repository.
Specifies the new label of the image.
Specifies the End User License Agreement. We recommend that the value is a URL.
Specifies the description of the operating system image.
Specifies a value that can be used to group operating system or virtual machine images.
Specifies the date when the operating system image was added to the image repository.
Specifies the URI that points to a document that contains the privacy policy related to the operating system image.
Specifies the size of the virtual machine.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Medium
-- Large
-- ExtraLarge

Specifies the operating system disk and data disk configuration for the virtual machine image created by using the New-AzureVMImageDiskConfigSet, Set-AzureVMImageOSDiskConfig, and Set-AzureVMImageDataDiskConfig cmdlets.
Specifies the language for the operating system in the virtual machine or operating system image.
Specifies the standard icon name for the operating system or virtual machine image.
Specifies the small icon name for the operating system or virtual machine image.
Specifies the Azure profile from which this cmdlet reads. If you do not specify a profile, this cmdlet reads from the local default profile.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Update an image by changing the image label --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Update-AzureVMImage -ImageName "Windows-Server-2008-SP2" -Label "DoNotUse"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command updates the image named Windows-Server-2008-SP2 by changing the image label to DoNotUse.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Get all operating systems by label and then update the label --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureVMImage | Where-Object {$_.Label -eq "DoNotUse" } | Update-AzureVMImage -Label "Updated"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all the operating system images labeled DoNotUse and changes the label to Updated.
